bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, January 20, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D FEB 20 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: No. 17 Consular Series. Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia, Jan. 20, 1899.
Subject: Advancements in local Consular Grades.
No. 17 Consular Series. Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia, Jan. 20, 1899.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that the Belgium Government, during the year 1898, advanced ints Vice Consulate, here, from that of a Vice Consulate to that of a Consulate, and appointed W. E. Dennis Esq. of Liberia Consul.
The Imperial German Government, which recalled her Vice Consul, here, early in 1898, who had became gratia non persona, from efforts made by him, in the claims of his
his Government for in December 1898; has recently advanced her Vice-Consulship to a Consul-ship, and has appointed Augustus Humplemayer Esq., a millionair; Imperial Consul to Liberia.
The Ecuadorian Government has recently appointed Hon. Thos., W. Howard, Treasurer of Liberia, Consul-General for Ecador to Liberia.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant Owen L. W. Smith M. R. and C. General.
Inclosure. Letter of advice, as to drafts Nos 22, Jan. 19, 1899 and 23 Jan. 20, 1899.
